page.title: 02FARMING IN THE OAKLEY AREA
page.content: In the Oakley area there are 8 farms with an average of 250 acres.Most of them were{dairy farms}but the farmers have found this unprofitable and have changed to{arable farming and raising {beef cattle.}None of the farms keep sheep or pigs.One of the farms rents out winter grazing for sheep but none raise sheep as dogs are a problem. {Main crops are barley and wheat.}Wheat is sold to D.B.Marshalls Chunky Chicks,barley is sold to distilleries. {Grain driers}are used in all farms as the distillers are particular about the percentage of moisture in the grain.Although the{combine harvester} is the most expensive piece of machinery farmers prefer to buy their own.Some hire out to other farms. Farming is now so efficient that few employ much outside labour.They are mostly family run.
